Package com.example.project_part_3.Database_functions

Class UserDatabase

java.lang.Object
com.example.project_part_3.Database_functions.UserDatabase
public class UserDatabase extends Object
High-level repository for managing User data. This class abstracts away the Task-based nature of the low-level Database class, exposing LiveData and simple callbacks for use in ViewModels and UI controllers.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserDatabase

      public UserDatabase()

  • Method Details

    • getAllUsers

      public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<List<User>> getAllUsers()
      Returns a LiveData object containing the list of all users. Observers of this object will receive real-time updates.

    • listenForSingleUser

      public void listenForSingleUser(String email, androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<User> userLiveData)
      Attaches a listener to a single user document to observe real-time changes (e.g., if their profile details are updated elsewhere).
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to observe.
      userLiveData - The MutableLiveData object from the ViewModel that will receive updates.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String email, UserDatabase.OnUserDeleteListener listener)
      Deletes a user by their email. This uses the low-level method which also handles deleting their associated events in a transaction.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to delete.
      listener - A callback to notify the caller of success or failure.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(User user, UserDatabase.OnUserAddListener listener)
      Adds a new user to the database.
      Parameters:
      user - The user object to add.
      listener - A callback to notify the caller of success or failure.

    • cleanupListeners

      public void cleanupListeners()
      Cleans up all active Firestore listeners managed by this repository. This is crucial to prevent memory leaks and should be called when the repository is no longer needed (e.g., in a ViewModel's onCleared() method).
